title._content: ["Mariemont," Thomas Josephus Emery house, Honeyman Hill, Middletown, Rhode Island. (LOC)

description._content: Johnston, Frances Benjamin,, 1864-1952,, photographer. ["Mariemont," Thomas Josephus Emery house, Honeyman Hill, Middletown, Rhode Island. Rockery] [1914 summer] 1 photograph : glass lantern slide, hand-colored ; 3.25 x 4 in. Notes: Site History. House Architecture: Richard Morris Hunt, designed 1871, altered by Thomas J. Emery circa 1901. Landscape: 19 acres by John Charles Olmsted, Henry Vincent Hubbard, James Frederick Dawson, Olmsted Brothers, 1903-1908. Associated Name: Mary Hopkins (Mrs. Thomas J.) Emery. Gardeners: Alexander Anderson and Andrew L. Dorwood. Today: House extant but gardens subdivided. On slide (handwritten): "E" and "Emery." Photographed when Frances Benjamin Johnston and Mattie Edwards Hewitt worked together. Title, date, and subject information provided by Sam Watters, 2011. Forms part of: Garden and historic house lecture series in the Frances Benjamin Johnston Collection (Library of Congress). Published in Gardens for a Beautiful America / Sam Watters. New York: Acanthus Press, 2012. Plate 15. Subjects: Rock gardens--Rhode Island--Newport--1910-1920. Format: Lantern slides--Hand-colored--1910-1920. Rights Info: No known restrictions on publication. Repository: Library of Congress, Prints and Photographs Division, Washington, D.C. 20540 USA, hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/pp.print Higher resolution image is available (Persistent URL): hdl.loc.gov/loc.pnp/ppmsca.16243 Call Number: LC-J717-X100- 34
